Updated November     pm





East Carolina Universitys Dance Team and Marching Pirates arrive to the annual homecoming Cannonball Kickoff PERIOD

East Carolina Universitys annual Homecoming Week began on Sept PERIOD  with Cannonball Kickoff from  to  p.m PERIOD which featured performances from the ECU Dance Team and the Marching Pirates Captain of the Ship top  announcement and a host of other activities geared toward engaging students PERIOD

Other activities offered were ECU trivia a Tshirt giveaway Tshirt tie dying and a showing of Back to the Future on the MCSC lawn at  p.m PERIOD with throwback snacks which included Gushers Twinkies Hugs Fruit Barrels and more PERIOD

As the event began the Marching Pirates and the ECU Dance Team marched across the mall and through the sonic plaza to the front of Main Campus Student Center Lawn then closed with the playing of the ECU Alma Mater Hail to Thy Name So Fair. following the performances homecoming chair and lead of the Cannonball Kickoff event Savannah Boyd welcomed the gathered students and gave a rundown of the evening and the upcoming weeks events PERIOD

Our Homecoming Committee couldnt be happier to have a normal homecoming once again PERIOD We encourage you all to participate in all of our homecoming events this week Boyd said at the event PERIOD

Boyd said in an interview prior to Cannonball Kickoff she likes to think of the event as an annual peprally PERIOD She said an event like the Cannonball Kickoff is important to the university as it promotes student involvement on campus PERIOD

While there are other ECU Homecoming events that organizations can participate in to win spirit cup points Boyd said the Cannonball Kickoff is an event at which anyone can participate PERIOD

It the Cannonball Kickoff lets students know that this is a university that cares about them and a university that wants to be as inclusive as possible Boyd said PERIOD I want to include all students I want all students to feel like they are a part of this ECU family they are a part of our Pirate Nation. eCU head football coach Mike Houston addressed the crowd of students and thanked them for their support at the last two home games PERIOD He thanked the Marching Pirates and ECU Dance team for what they do to keep the fans energized at games PERIOD

Houston said he was excited about this weeks football game and he is thankful to have fans back in the stadium at games PERIOD He said he encourages everyone to come out to support the Pirates at the homecoming game on Oct PERIOD  PERIOD

What a difference you made this past weekend PERIOD It was so great to have you back in the Boneyard you made such an impact on the game PERIOD It makes such an impact on the atmosphere to have you there with us yelling and screaming and cheering on our team Houston said PERIOD I just want to tell you how much I appreciate you and how much the team appreciates you. catherine Francis a senior psychology major said it was the first event she had attended since the semester started and she was excited to be back at an event in a normal inperson format PERIOD

Francis said she is a member of the Moment of Magic club which is participating in the spirit cup competition so she is excited to see who wins at the end of the week PERIOD She said the Cannonball Kickoff event is a good way for students to meet one another and take their minds off of their academics PERIOD

I think it really just helps connect people Francis said PERIOD I know in the years prior most of the time if someone was sitting alone people would join and be like Hey can I join you I know Im waiting for a few of my friends to get here but I mean it just kind of brings the fun back without it focusing on purely studies. log In
